product_name: Lawn & Home Insect Control Pest Kit

sections.faq:
Where can I use this?
The Lawn & Home Barrier Pest Kit is appropriate for all typical turfgrass lawns, as well as homes experiencing extensive pest issues from crawling and flying near the home structure.
How does it work?
Lawn Vitality boosts initial grass growth and provides deep greening from nitrogen and iron. Plus it contains molasses to help boost soil life.
Bug Doom’s active ingredients pyrethrin and canola oil act on contact to affect the nervous system (pyrethrins) and respiratory system (canola oil) of pests.
What does it control?
Targeted insects include ants (excluding fire ants, harvester ants, Pharaoh ants, and carpenter ants), bed bugs, beetles, boxelder bugs, carpet beetles, caterpillars, centipedes, clothes moths, American cockroaches, crickets, darkling beetles, dermestids, earwigs, Elm leaf beetles, firebrats, hide beetles, house flies, kudzu bugs, leather beetles, non-biting midges, millipedes, moths, multicolored Asian lady beetles, pantry pests, pillbugs, silverfish, sowbugs, spiders (excluding black widow, brown recluse, and hobo spiders), and stink bugs (including brown marmorated stink bugs).
In what order should I use products?
Ideally, apply Lawn Vitality first. Using your sprayer attachment and hose, uniformly apply the nutrients across your lawn. If the lawn is adjacent to the home, allow liquid lawn nutrients to dry. Once dry, apply Bug Doom Home Insect Control as directed to the outdoor perimeter and Bug Doom Indoor Spray to entry points and pest populations inside the home. Going forward, reapply pest control products as needed and use your Let’s Get Growing guide to implement better yard care practices.
When is the best time to apply?
Throughout the growing season, meaning spring through fall, to manage pests during peak activity and to maintain lawns during the growing season. Indoor pest control can be applied year-round as needed.
Best application tips
Apply Lawn Vitality to actively growing lawns, and ensure your lawn is sufficiently hydrated before application.
Do not apply products when rain is expected in 3 hours.
Apply pest control according to the label.
If pest bait accidentally gets wet, reapply the product.
Natural pest prevention, or integrated pest management (IPM), is the key to managing pests effectively.
